intro: Toxocarpus ovalifolius, commonly known as the oval-leaf toxocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
